physical_appearance: In this drawing, curvy lines cover the entire surface of the paper. In the middle (but nearer to the bottom), is a child-like, almost simplistic drawing of a fish. A tiny figure with stick thin legs stand atop the fish.
sgcool_label_text: The personal story behind this work, like in Gosh, we are fucked, revolves around a holiday surfing trip to Phuket during the monsoon season. The repetition of the wave motif, even more evident and chaotic in this piece, obscures the image beneath it, and therefore suggests of an even greater nightmarish as the artist has recurring dreams revolving around the same event. The surrealist imagery and title of the work point out the bizarre amalgamation of fact and fantasy that constitute dreams. waves like a champ later on â€“ revolving around a holiday surfing trip to Phuket during the monsoon season.
context_1: Dusadee + Dusit + Lovers + Dead Ones exhibition
context_21: 7th Floor, Center of Academic Resources, Chulalongkorn University, Phyathai Road, Pathum Wan, Bangkok 10330, Thailand.
title_text: Surfing The Monsoon Waves With The Fish
subject_terms_1: fear memory  dreams  waves (natural events)  fish (animals)?
